intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium murorum subsp. neritodon, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers and basal rosette of leaves. The plant typically grows in moist meadows, grasslands, and along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. The subspecies neritodon is distinguished by its slightly different leaf morphology and flowering habits compared to other subspecies of Hieracium murorum.
